Replying to @aral 2020-06-22 18:59
@aral One of the things I like about Jamstack is that pregenerated static assets are highly portable. Meaning that there are fewer ties to any given host.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @scottpdawson 2020-06-22 11:56
@scottpdawson Yeah, that's what I do. And sadly not, the image transformation happens when served via the CDN, so it's not possible to do that locally until it has been deployed. I sometimes add redirects for nicer URLs. Then I can use them locally to get transformed assets via netlify dev
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @aral 2020-06-22 11:50
@aral Nice! One small clarification about #Jamstack though... you don't need to use 3rd party APIs (or even 1st party APIs, or JavaScript) for a site to be Jamstack. Mostly, it is about pre-rendering so a site can be served directly from a CDN, and decoupling APIs if you have them.
